title: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
description: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
OB: When invoking the 'New Java Package' feature, the following message appears at the top before any input is provided: 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'. However, the package name field is empty at this point. This message is confusing and unclear. I am unsure of its meaning. Should this message be displayed? If it is an error, should it be shown in red with an error icon?
EB: When invoking the 'New Java Package' feature, there should be no message displayed before any input is provided in the package name field. The message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' should only appear if the user enters a package name that already corresponds to an existing folder. If such a case occurs, the message should be displayed in red with an error icon to indicate it is an error/warning. The message should clearly explain that the package name entered already exists as a folder.
SR:
1. Invoke the 'New Java Package' feature.
2. Observe that before entering anything in the package name field, a message stating 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' is displayed at the top.
3. Verify that the package name field is initially empty.
4. Verify that the message is unclear and confusing.
5. Verify that the message should only appear if the user enters a package name that already corresponds to an existing folder.
6. Verify that if the message is displayed, it should be shown in red with an error icon.
7. Verify that the message clearly explains that the package name entered already exists as a folder.
